document.title: Maryland College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts Grades 1-2

BCC65B9C4E1341F1AF8D52EF810EDF5C.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading
and being read to, and responding to texts, including using adjectives
and adverbs to describe (e.g., When other kids are happy that makes
me happy.)

0650587A1FDE4ECEBDA11BF7DB2376E6.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs
(e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely related adjectives (e.g., thin,
slender, skinny, scrawny).

E07A32F2336C475E84D9CDE022489205.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use
(e.g., describe foods that are spicy or juicy).

9483F191072741768D7D31909D3F627F.description:
understanding of word relationships and nuances in
word meanings.

1C71DC34574340BDB98B6DB331165C49.description:
Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries, both print and
digital, to determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases.

3D6E5D213EA94A068EE202807B39BD00.description:
Use knowledge of the meaning of individual words to predict
the meaning of compound words (e.g., birdhouse, lighthouse,
housefly; bookshelf, notebook, bookmark).

ADFEFF90C90B4B81845716CBC05CBCF0.description:
Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an
unknown word with the same root (e.g., addition, additional).

276240E66A6643AD9CFE6B528522D61E.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a
known prefix is added to a known word (e.g., happy/unhappy,
tell/retell).

8242A9442E97473A80CD528C870552F2.description:
Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a
word or phrase.

623BF4EFF04141C78D676DE3827CE0CB.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple
meaning words and phrases based on grade 2 reading and content,
choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

3E40C0ECD519468B8D7B48D2BE5E47C8.description: Compare formal and informal uses of English.

29C44A808FC04DE7BB1AB1140F0F6505.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing,
speaking, reading, or listening.

2CA3A4C49D0348ACACE8B20C1933B1FA.description:
Consult reference materials, including beginning
dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

216EDD4F78DE45CE833B1FCE2F6238A9.description:
Generalize learned spelling patterns when writing words
(e.g., cage → badge; boy → boil).

AC16F2DB7E9141BBAD6E1DA9D283BEE9.description:
Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently
occurring possessives.

0D3C0702D6804D2289FA4E7D79210CD8.description: Use commas in greetings and closings of letters.

9340FB468ABD4DBD8C8316C3C594642B.description: Capitalize holidays, product names, and geographic names.

18AD469321E54AE5B90E52957E2B24F1.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English
capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

40007C3B9FCD40F189E79D69E5D12977.description:
Produce, expand, and rearrange complete simple and
compound sentences (e.g., The boy watched the movie; The little
boy watched the movie; The action movie was watched by the little
boy).

EA94596EBA604C8F90EF38DBE54963FC.description:
Use adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them
depending on what is to be modified.

5134D0062494415D99C49EC51A568FD8.description:
Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring
irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid, told).

1C0B5B9B1E8F46C9AB935B94B037005E.description:
Form and use frequently occurring irregular plural nouns
(e.g., feet, children, teeth, mice, fish).

080F79DE06024AF5922871CCE59FDFC7.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English
grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

DFBEB36008CD44B9B0AD431C54A76DA7.description:
Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and
situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.
(See grade 2 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

6CCDC8CDEC594E2B85CB7DF6FE5EB188.description:
Create audio recordings of stories or poems; add drawings or
other visual displays to stories or recounts of experiences when
appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

5EE076B83D8D4D47824D6114C55280E2.description:
Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate
facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking audibly in
coherent sentences.

EECE5F57ADED464A9F695303FEA88FB4.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to
clarify comprehension, gather additional information, or deepen
understanding of a topic or issue.

1021C640AFE043EEAEDED8DC964ABC82.description:
Recount or describe key ideas or details from a text read aloud or
information presented orally or through other media.

0007F9EA851A4FEEBE7CDD2A4C8D77A7.description:
Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed
about the topics and texts under discussion.

A9AFE63D8A434EE78C0C8D6A503A8C5E.description:
Build on others' talk in conversations by linking their
comments to the remarks of others.

BC8E39844C194F64B40C4CFB7D291015.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussion (e.g., gaining the
floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one
at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

ECBFCA1A5D034B319278B7BAE68E4FC7.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners
about grade 2 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger
groups.

5F6A30FA0BE34828A839725D80809853.description:
Recall information from experiences or gather information from
provided sources to answer a question.

D667501881E044B8A5CD3FBFA9932EE7.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a
number of books on a single topic to produce a report; record science
observations).

6A719558F8F143F38D977471CEC5E418.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

0CA64B3BCAA747919A998BE1C983E0CB.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital
tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with
peers.

69EE7F7EC6094E27BDC8D353C8A29F08.description:
With guidance and support from adults and peers, focus on a
topic and strengthen writing as needed by revising and editing.

D9480E623C804D5CA41943DB2B9E0E96.description:
Write narratives in which they recount a well- elaborated event or
short sequence of events, include details to describe actions, thoughts,
and feelings, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide a
sense of closure.

403E6131C4E44205AAE190CA7FA79185.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts in which they introduce a
topic, use facts and definitions to develop points, and provide a
concluding statement or section.

A1B7E730FA094F8EB77624B7534B6050.description:
Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or book
they are writing about, state an opinion, supply reasons that support
the opinion, use linking words

1B04C4A98A20490D98AC97607C2C2F41.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition
and understanding, rereading as necessary.

03790116883D4B889FDC065E3284DF53.description:
Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate
rate, and expression on successive readings.

B2152D4860D848E1B13D6272D9862E2D.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

82C123E0A6564897924F3641AAE98702.description:
Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support
comprehension.

78EBF7C5161047A4B2656DFA1FE4823B.description:
Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled
words.

75702CE57CAE40CBBE86E1D97F588EE1.description: Identify words with inconsistent but common spelling-sound correspondences.

0DD4349D51B44BA1A4891A3BAB40A800.description: Decode words with common prefixes and suffixes.

E46D172111514B7793076F5968DCA891.description:
Decode regularly spelled two-syllable words with long
vowels.

DE1B2F31BF524A588D5BA27E05FE4918.description:
Know spelling-sound correspondences for additional
common vowel teams.

636A7D2AF9A345E5AC1B58928CEA7D79.description:
Distinguish long and short vowels when reading regularly
spelled one-syllable words.

50E9E6DE28814A0BB0A3B06391091B31.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in
decoding words.

288F317AE7FB4B7A8BE66C0BF2EF7949.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational
texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts,
in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding
as needed at the high end of the range.

11FE5B102A7448DCB17D7C0A9975DD68.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

00C9E6DE93234862B726D89943DD7870.description:
Compare and contrast the most important points presented by
two texts on the same topic.

EEF7F5B0D9BF46DA8F68B964F63BC052.description:
Describe how reasons support specific points the author makes in
a text.

08A8E60AE3BF4DB998C75E0ACBD79C3E.description:
Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram showing how a
machine works) contribute to and clarify a text.

13A6ABDEF831419EA88774AE7C4561E7.description:
Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author
wants to answer, explain, or describe.

5F2ADE415C6D424CBF4C9B1B1BD91783.description:
Know and use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print,
subheadings, glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate key
facts or information in a text efficiently.

9135C2A52A844623B57EB2E09583D78A.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to
a grade 2 topic or subject area.

66048018D7E14F58A56F75BB0A92979C.description:
Describe the connection between a series of historic events,
scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text.

D400330EBFAC4451B2D5B494B26A9EB6.description:
Identify the main topic of a multipara graph text as well as the
focus of specific paragraphs within the text.

2337B91D345640FCB8D746F27734D134.description:
Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why,
and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

936AB0F3FFE5424F9843FD8AFCB4EBD2.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature,
including stories and poetry, in the grades 2-3 text complexity band
proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

38CAB8E7959C419AA06EB352DB7AE11F.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A21901A9C09C4FAFBDEFAB68F6EE265D.description:
Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story
(e.g., Cinderella stories) by different authors or from different cultures.

98D249235CDE436FAE5405C603E75CB6.description:
Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a print
or digital text to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or
plot.

5AE45D4009EA4229AEA8F3055E737C11.description:
Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters,
including by speaking in a different voice for each character when
reading dialogue aloud.

018C68DF70C44F6EAB0043707F675B58.description:
Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing how
the beginning introduces the story and the ending concludes the action.

312B0E054A6E463DB657BF59A90E74A6.description:
Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration,
rhymes, repeated lines) supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or
song.

98DE3FAB8FB446BDBC4F7B2079AD65C4.description:
Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and
challenges.

0B4CAE74638F470EAA7F8A31FFB6FB3E.description:
Recount stories, including fables and folktales from diverse
cultures, and determine their central message, lesson, or moral.

EBEEA168966A470DB19878F469451AE3.description:
Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why,
and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.
